article.title: Geodesic X-ray tomography for piecewise constant functions on nontrapping manifolds

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about the simplices in Figure 1 is **incorrect**?
choices: Simplices Δ1, Δ2, and Δ3 are classified as the "first type" in the proof of Lemma 5.1.
Simplex Δ4 is classified as the "second type" in the proof of Lemma 5.1.
The dashed lines represent geodesics within the neighborhood V.
Simplices Δ5, Δ6, and Δ7 are classified as the "third type" in the proof of Lemma 5.1.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (2) defines a function f(x,y) in the upper half-plane H+.  What kind of function is f(x,y)?
Formula (10) gives the determinant of matrix A defined in (9). What condition on the values αi guarantees that this determinant is non-zero?
choices: All αi must be rational numbers.
All αi must be greater than 1.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (22) in Lemma 4.2 relates the integral of a function f along geodesics to its tangent function Txf. What does this lemma essentially establish?
choices: The continuity of f at the boundary point x.
The smoothness of f at the boundary point x.
A connection between the global and local behavior of f near the boundary point x.
The value of f at the boundary point x.
